title: Greet light IS present on charger. *No boot.  <s>[INST] [MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]A1278[/MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]: A1278 is a model number for a 13" size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115. [/INST]</s>  <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-3115[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-3115 fits a MacBook Pro Unibody computer from year Mid 2012 whose model number is <s>[INST] [MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]A1278[/MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]: A1278 is a model number for a 13" size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115. [/INST]</s> with a screen size of 13" and an EMC number of EMC 2554 [/INST]</s>-B
message:
[B]Hi![/B]

[B]Green light IS present on charger. No boot.[/B]

[B]<s>[INST] [MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]A1278[/MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]: A1278 is a model number for a 13" size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115. [/INST]</s>[/B]

[B]<s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-3115[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-3115 fits a MacBook Pro Unibody computer from year Mid 2012 whose model number is <s>[INST] [MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]A1278[/MACBOOK_MODEL_NUMBERS]: A1278 is a model number for a 13" size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115. [/INST]</s> with a screen size of 13" and an EMC number of EMC 2554 [/INST]</s>-B[/B]


[B]No 3 volt rails present[/B]


[B]<s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]PPDCIN_G3H[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger. [/INST]</s> is present at [RESISTORS]r7010[/RESISTORS][/B]

[B]<s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]CHGR_ACIN[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: CHGR_ACIN is a signal that is created by a voltage divider between the charger and ground that goes into the <s>[INST] [CHIPS]ISL6258[/CHIPS]: This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2008 through 2009 [/INST]</s>, <s>[INST] [CHIPS]ISL6259[/CHIPS]: This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015 [/INST]</s>, <s>[INST] [CHIPS]ISL9239[/CHIPS]: This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2016-2018 responsible for charging the battery and creating the power rail PPBUS_G3H [/INST]</s>, or <s>[INST] [CHIPS]ISL9240[/CHIPS]: This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2018 through 2020 [/INST]</s> chip that creates PPBUS_G3H. It is necessary for SMC_BC_ACOK & <s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]CHGR_ACOK[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: This is identical to SMC_BC_ACOK. This will come out of the <s>[INST] [CHIPS]ISL6258[/CHIPS]: This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2008 through 2009 [/INST]</s> or <s>[INST] [CHIPS]ISL6259[/CHIPS]: This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015 [/INST]</s> charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.   [/INST]</s> to be present so that the onewire circuit is told to turn on & allow the SMC to speak to the charger. [/INST]</s> not present [/B]

[B]<s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]CHGR_ACIN[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: CHGR_ACIN is a signal that is created by a voltage divider between the charger and ground that goes into the <s>[INST] [CHIPS]ISL6258[/CHIPS]: This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2008 through 2009 [/INST]</s>, <s>[INST] [CHIPS]ISL6259[/CHIPS]: This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015 [/INST]</s>, <s>[INST] [CHIPS]ISL9239[/CHIPS]: This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2016-2018 responsible for charging the battery and creating the power rail PPBUS_G3H [/INST]</s>, or <s>[INST] [CHIPS]ISL9240[/CHIPS]: This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2018 through 2020 [/INST]</s> chip that creates PPBUS_G3H. It is necessary for SMC_BC_ACOK & <s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]CHGR_ACOK[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: This is identical to SMC_BC_ACOK. This will come out of the <s>[INST] [CHIPS]ISL6258[/CHIPS]: This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2008 through 2009 [/INST]</s> or <s>[INST] [CHIPS]ISL6259[/CHIPS]: This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015 [/INST]</s> charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.   [/INST]</s> to be present so that the onewire circuit is told to turn on & allow the SMC to speak to the charger. [/INST]</s> has resistance of only 2.5Ω to ground so it’s shorted right? Replace U7000?[/B]


[B]Thank you!![/B]

message:
I will remove [CAPACITORS]C7011[/CAPACITORS] first.
If still short, U7000 is fried for sure.
